whitelistUpdates.title: CLI Stable Release v1.5.16
whitelistUpdates.description: Direct stable release from main branch. Version 1.5.16 built and published directly from the latest main branch.

whitelistUpdates.title: CLI Stable Release v1.5.15
whitelistUpdates.description: Direct stable release from main branch. Version 1.5.15 built and published directly from the latest main branch.

whitelistUpdates.title: @continuedev/llm-info@1.7.0 - Major Feature Updates
whitelistUpdates.description: Major update featuring removal of TTY requirement for CLI in headless mode, added support for Gemini thought signature, opus 4-5 updates, and numerous bug fixes including TypeScript errors, MCP secret loading improvements, and terminal security enhancements.

whitelistUpdates.title: @continuedev/config-yaml@1.36.0 - JCEF Integration and MCP Cookbook
whitelistUpdates.description: Added JCEF reload action, Klavis AI's Strata to MCP Cookbook, and extensive bug fixes. Enhanced terminal security with newline bypass prevention and TypeScript type annotations. Multiple dependency upgrades including axios and undici.

whitelistUpdates.title: @continuedev/llm-info@1.6.0 - Enhanced Features
whitelistUpdates.description: Added JCEF reload action and Klavis AI's Strata to MCP Cookbook. Multiple security improvements including terminal security enhancements and dependency upgrades.

insights.title: State of LLM Code Generation in Late 2024
insights.description: Analysis of current capabilities and limitations of AI coding assistants, with focus on practical applications vs. hype. Discussion around context window improvements and multi-file project understanding.
insights.author: Simon Willison

insights.title: Replit's New AI Agent Capabilities
insights.description: Introduction of enhanced agentic coding features in Replit, including better project-wide understanding, debugging assistance, and real-time collaboration with AI.
insights.author: Amjad Masad

insights.title: The Future of Programming Education with AI
insights.description: Discussion on how AI coding assistants are changing programming education, both for beginners and experienced developers learning new technologies.
insights.author: Lex Fridman

insights.title: Scaling Laws for Code Generation Models
insights.description: Technical insights into how larger models and better training data are improving code quality, with practical benchmarks and real-world performance metrics.
insights.author: Andrej Karpathy

insights.title: Agentic AI vs. Traditional IDEs: A Developer Survey
insights.description: Community discussion on Hacker News about the trade-offs between AI-powered coding assistants and traditional development environments, with focus on productivity and learning.
insights.author: Community

insights.title: Building Custom AI Coding Assistants
insights.description: Tutorial on fine-tuning models for specific programming domains and coding styles, with practical examples and deployment strategies.
insights.author: Simon Willison

insights.title: The Economics of AI Coding Tools
insights.description: Analysis of the business models behind AI coding assistants, pricing strategies, and the long-term sustainability of current approaches.
insights.author: Amjad Masad

insights.title: AI-Generated Code Quality Metrics
insights.description: Research paper discussing methods for evaluating code quality in AI-generated code, including security, maintainability, and performance considerations.
insights.author: Academic Research

insights.title: Multi-Modal AI for Development
insights.description: Exploration of how vision models and other modalities are being integrated into coding tools, including screenshot-to-code and diagram-to-code capabilities.
insights.author: Community

insights.title: The Human-AI Coding Partnership
insights.description: Philosophical discussion on the optimal relationship between human developers and AI assistants, focusing on augmentation rather than replacement.
insights.author: Lex Fridman
